resume.name: Alice ([!] Resume Template)
resume.summary: Frontend engineer focused on the React / Next.js ecosystem, experienced in building and scaling products for international startups. Skilled in system design, RSC/Server Actions architecture, performance optimization, and developer experience (DX) tooling. Passionate about crafting maintainable, high-performance web applications that balance technical excellence with real user impact.

works.jobTitle: Senior Frontend Engineer â†’ Frontend Architect

projects.name: PulseBoard
description: PulseBoard is a real-time analytics and collaboration platform for startups, combining task tracking, AI summaries, and team dashboards.
Architected the frontend from scratch using Next.js 15 (RSC + Server Actions) as a lightweight BFF layer, reducing bundle size by 34%.
Built a modular component system (Radix + Shadcn) supporting theming and multi-tenant branding.
Designed fine-grained access control and workspace isolation for enterprise-grade security and maintainability.

projects.name: StreamDesk
description: Led development of a real-time accounting and CRM platform for cross-border startups, integrating AI-powered reconciliation and analytics.
Implemented edge-deployed data sync using Prisma + PostgreSQL + Redis, cutting report latency by 40%.
Migrated the codebase to a micro-frontend structure with Turborepo, reducing build times from 5m â†’ 1.8m.
Standardized CI/CD pipelines and automated tests for feature branches via GitHub Actions.

projects.name: EchoSpaces
description: Built the internal observability platform powering all FlowSync SaaS products.
Integrated Sentry and OpenTelemetry for full-stack tracing across edge functions and RSC routes.
Developed a lightweight monitoring SDK enabling real-time user session replay and performance heatmaps.
Achieved a 41% drop in production error rate and a 35% improvement in debugging efficiency.

projects.name: NovaOS
description: Developed NovaOS, a unified control panel for remote teams integrating project management, tickets, and analytics.
Implemented streaming SSR and Suspense data fetching for progressive rendering (first-load performance +45%).
Created an abstraction layer for UI components to unify design patterns across multiple internal teams.
Introduced an E2E testing suite (Cypress + MSW) improving release stability by 30%.

projects.name: PayNova
description: Subscription billing SaaS for EU startups, supporting multi-currency payments, tax automation, and self-serve checkout.
Integrated Stripe + SEPA APIs, implemented a unified payment adapter layer, and improved accuracy of multi-currency settlements.
Built a fully dynamic checkout form system (React Hook Form + Zod Schema) ensuring type-safe validation.
Helped increase average monthly GMV by 9.3% and conversion rate by 12% during product growth phase.

projects.name: BreezeDash
description: Developed BreezeDash, a real-time SaaS analytics dashboard aggregating IoT and business KPIs.
Optimized table rendering with virtualization and lazy chunking, achieving smooth rendering for 100k+ rows.
Refactored global state management using Redux Toolkit to improve maintainability and code clarity.
Reduced UI rendering latency by 55% through batching and memoization.

projects.name: Orion UI
descriptions: An accessible headless component library built with React 19 and Radix UI, providing composable interaction primitives for design systems.
Implemented prop-driven variant patterns and dynamic theming with Tailwind 4, supporting brand-level customization.
Integrated Storybook + Vitest testing pipeline ensuring SSR and RSC compatibility across all components.
Adopted internally by five independent projects and used as the base for a design language system.

projects.name: next-accelerator
descriptions: A production-ready Next.js boilerplate targeting early-stage startups for fast MVP delivery.
Includes authentication (NextAuth + Clerk), RBAC permissions, audit logging, and i18n out of the box.
Integrates Turborepo and CI pipelines for monorepo deployments across multiple environments.
Combines tRPC with Server Actions to achieve isomorphic data access and reduce API maintenance overhead.

projects.name: LedgerFlow
descriptions: An open-source finance and invoicing manager built for freelancers and SMBs.
Implements virtualized data tables capable of handling millions of rows with smooth scrolling and lazy loading.
Combines Zod schema validation with react-hook-form for robust type-safe form handling.
Features rule-based anomaly detection, custom tagging, and automated reconciliation workflows.

projects.name: snap-form
descriptions: A high-performance form engine supporting dynamic fields, progressive validation, and server-side submission.
Leverages React Server Components and Server Actions to offload validation logic to the backend.
Provides a schema-driven DSL for form generation, enabling admin users to define complex forms visually.
Adopted across multiple SaaS products for building configuration panels and onboarding flows.

projects.name: edge-cache-kit
descriptions: A caching utility toolkit for Edge Functions, supporting ISR, tag-based revalidation, and smart backfill policies.
Implements intelligent LRU eviction and hot-key protection, achieving 92% cache hit rate in production.
Deployed across Cloudflare Workers and Vercel Edge environments for multiple high-traffic apps.

projects.name: openapi-safe-client
descriptions: Generates type-safe API clients and Zod validators directly from OpenAPI specifications.
Supports schema merging, request mocking (MSW), and automated contract testing in CI pipelines.
Standardizes API typing across frontend teams, reducing interface compatibility errors by over 80%.
